intro: Macrocentrum parvulum, commonly known as the small-flowered macrocentrum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its blooming period occurs during the rainy season, and it is often found growing in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
